HBc inhibits the IFITM1 transcription by disturbing the stability of PBAF complex in vitro. HBc acts as a tumor suppressor as well, by blocking the transcription of the human tumorigenesis-associated genes, IFN and p53 [11,35]. PBAF complexes facilitate the initiation of IFITM1 transcription. the interaction of HBc with BAF200 interferes with binding between BAF180 and BAF200. thus, the efficient process of the PBAF complex is interrupted. this leads to the suppression of IFITM1 transcription. of HBV infection.
